name: Polio deaths per 100,000 people
descriptionShort: Reported deaths from acute polio per 100,000 people in a given year. The reported figures include both [wild-](#dod:wild-poliovirus) and [vaccine-derived poliovirus](#dod:vaccine-derived-poliovirus) infections that occurred indigenously and as imported cases.
datasetName: Long-run reported polio deaths in the United States
descriptionKey: Data on reported deaths from acute polio have been compiled from historical Public Health Reports for the United States and from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report.
Acute polio deaths are defined as deaths from an acute polio infection, and not post-polio syndrome.
The first polio vaccine was created by Jonas Salk, it was licensed and began to be administered in 1955.
A second polio vaccine was created by Albert Sabin in 1960.

origins.title: Historical polio deaths in the United States - Public Health Reports
origins.description:
Data on historical polio deaths in the United States, compiled from a selection of sources from the United States - Public Health Reports.

Sources for each year are as follows:

* 1910-11: [Public Health Reports Vol. 27, No. 16 “Poliomyelitis in the United States, 1910 and 1911"](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4567726?seq=4)

* 1913: [Public Health Reports Vol. 29, No. 28 “The Notifiable Diseases: Their Prevalence by States during 1913”](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4570998?seq=12)

* 1914: [Public Health Reports Vol. 39, No. 36 “The Notifiable Diseases: Reported Prevalence during 1914 by States”](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4572751?seq=7)

* 1915-1937: [Public Health Reports Vol. 54, No. 21 “Prevalence of Poliomyelitis in the United States in 1938”](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4582892?seq=1)

* 1938: [Public Health Reports Vol. 55, No. 10 “Notifiable Diseases in the United States, 1938: Morbidity and Mortality Summaries for Certain Important Communicable Diseases"](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4583204?seq=1)

* 1939: [Public Health Reports, Vol. 56, No. 7 - Notifiable Diseases in the United States, 1939: Morbidity and Mortality Summaries for Certain Important Communicable Diseases (1941)](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4583620)

* 1940: [Public Health Reports, Vol. 57, No. 7 - Notifiable Diseases in the United States, 1940: Morbidity and Mortality Summaries for Certain Important Communicable Diseases (1942)](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4584013)

* 1942-1947: [Public Health Reports Vol. 63, No. 13 - Incidence of Poliomyelitis in 1947](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4586491)

* 1948-1949: [Public Health Reports Vol. 67, No. 6 - Poliomyelitis in the United States, 1951](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4588131)

origins.title: Historical polio deaths in the United States - Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
origins.description:
Data on historical polio deaths in the United States, compiled from a selection of sources from the US CDC.

Sources for each year are as follows:

* 1950-1959: [Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report Annual Supplement Summary 1993 Vol. 9, No. 53 by the Communicable Disease Center, Public Health Service, U.S. Department of Health Education and Welfare.](https://www.globalhealthchronicles.org/items/show/6303)

* 1960-1967: [Reported Incidence of Notifiable Diseases in the United States, 1970. Morbidity and Mortality Vol. 19, No. 53 (1971)](https://www.jstor.org/stable/44323897?read-now=1&seq=5#page_scan_tab_contents)

* 1968-1978: [Compressed Mortality, 1968-1978 - CDC Wonder (ICD-8)](https://wonder.cdc.gov/cmf-icd8.html)

* 1979-1998: [Compressed Mortality, 1979-1998 - CDC Wonder (ICD-9)](https://wonder.cdc.gov/cmf-icd9.html)

* 1999-2020: [Compressed Mortality, 1999-2020 - CDC Wonder (ICD-10)](https://wonder.cdc.gov/cmf-icd10.html)
origins.producer: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
origins.citationFull:

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citationFull: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
